fields.creator: Gus Van Sant
fields.title: My Own Private Idaho
fields.info: Mike Waters lives on the street and befriends the somewhat older and streetwise Scott Favor who shows him what is necessary to survive. Waters suffers from narcolepsy and can fall asleep at any moment and in almost any circumstance. Favor comes from a rich family and is rebelling against his own background. They travel together extensively - Waters is driven by the need to find his biological mother - and spend time in Italy. Later in life however, Favor has joined mainstream society and has little time for his old friend.

fields.creator: Steven Soderbergh
fields.title: Erin Brockovich
fields.info: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.

fields.creator: Gregg Araki
fields.title: Mysterious Skin
fields.info: A teenage hustler and a young man obsessed with alien abductions cross paths, together discovering a horrible, liberating truth.

fields.creator: Rihanna ft. Justin Timberlake
fields.title: Rehab
fields.info: "Rehab" is a song recorded by Barbadian singer Rihanna for her third studio album, Good Girl Gone Bad. Def Jam Recordings serviced the song to contemporary hit radio in the United States on October 6, 2008, as the eighth and final single from the album.

fields.creator: Duke Dumont
fields.title: Ocean Drive
fields.info: "Ocean Drive" is a song by British DJ and record producer Duke Dumont, and features uncredited vocals by Boy Matthews. It was released as the lead single from his seventh extended play, Blasé Boys Club Part 1, on 31 July 2015. A music video for the song was also released on 15 September through Vevo and YouTube.

fields.creator: Childish Gambino
fields.title: Feels Like Summer
fields.info: "Feels Like Summer" is a song by American recording artist Childish Gambino. The song was released by Wolf+Rothstein, Liberator Music and RCA Records on July 11, 2018. It was written and produced by Gambino and his longtime collaborator Ludwig Göransson.

fields.creator: V & A
fields.title: Renaissance Watercolours: from Dürer to Van Dyck
fields.info: Bringing together 200 rarely-seen masterpieces, this exhibition presents the exquisite medium as a unified art form for the first time, and explores its pivotal role in understanding, interpreting and documenting the natural world.

fields.creator: Various
fields.title: Titian: Love, Desire, Death
fields.info: Bodies flailing through the air, mythical creatures rushing by in a blur, golden rays of light and mounds and mounds of flesh: Titian’s poesie series is wild, dramatic, violent and very, very sensual. The Renaissance master’s works are reunited in full here for the first time since the 1500s.

fields.creator: Edmund de Waal
fields.title: Edmund de Waal: Library of Exile
fields.info: It stings the heart, this installation by Edmund de Waal. The ceramicist and author has lined the walls of his room within a room in the British Museum with books by writers in exile. Albert Camus’s ‘Exile and the Kingdom’, Jean Rhys’s ‘Wide Sargasso Sea’, Ovid’s ‘Metamorphoses’. Shelf after shelf of stories written by people far from home, thinking of home.
